title: Young Workers Rake In Biggest Wage Gains in Tight Labor Market
sub_head: Employers offer higher pay and other incentives as they compete to fill many service jobs
body:
The country’s youngest workers are securing the fastest wage increases of any age group, the only one whose gains have outpaced inflation.
Their pay progress reflects employers’ strong demand for labor as the economy recovers from the pandemic’s effects, particularly for many service jobs, such as at restaurants and retail stores, that tend to employ younger workers.
